activities.description: Task: Buddy startup recap: summarize last session context in chat bubble
activities.details:
On session end (X, Alt+F4, crash, reset), capture a summary of the last ~10 messages/actions. On next app launch in that project folder, buddy shows the summary in a pixel-art chat bubble above his head with real-time text fill and chat sound effects (same as deliberations).

Key challenges:
1. Crash-safe capture: need a mechanism that works even on hard exits (Alt+F4, crash)
2. Detached summarizer: subprocess that outlives the main app to write the summary
3. Buddy chat bubble UI: pixel-art box, typewriter text fill, chat sounds
4. Project-scoped: summary tied to the project folder, not global

Approach options to deliberate:
A) Detached Node subprocess on close event -- spawned with detached:true, summarizes, writes file
B) Rolling buffer -- continuously write last N activity items so crash just uses the buffer as-is (no AI call needed)
C) Hybrid -- rolling buffer for crash safety, AI summary on clean exit for nicer output

activities.description: Decision: Buddy recap: hybrid rolling buffer + AI summary on clean exit
activities.details:
Chosen: Hybrid: rolling buffer continuously writes last ~10 activity items (crash-safe baseline). On clean exit, detached Node subprocess upgrades the raw buffer into an AI-generated summary. Buddy displays whichever exists -- polished if available, raw if crash.
Rolling buffer costs nothing (same pattern as activity.json). AI summary on clean exit gives a nicer experience when possible. Crash fallback to raw buffer means we never lose context. Best of both worlds.

activities.description: [ARCHITECTURE] Memory scoring formula: exponential decay + access boost + failure penalty
